page.title: 03Changing Times Since 1953
page.content: In 1953, East Hoathly had a Blacksmith. The farmers used horses to plough the fields. Today, there is a Stud but no Blacksmith. The old Rectory had a metal gate at its entrance which was on the main road, where the recreation ground is today. A new Rectory and Rectory Cloae with its 22 houses have been built in its garden. Church Marks Lane was the allotments. Buttsfield Lane had a Chapel which has been demolished. The Butcher, Grocer and Baker used to deliver daily by van. People walked or biked to work. They had two buses an hour each way from 7.00a.m. to 10.00p.m.
